review_description: Looks like a recurring theme here - XM suddenly stopped working.  That's because XM suddenly decided to make us pay for using the Alexa skill when we already have a subscription to the service.  When the skill came out it was advertised and written about in several articles as a new 'perk' for Alexa owners and XM subscribers (no mention of needing to pay extra for in-home streaming). My original XM sub used to allow for 1 home device.  So now there is an additional cost to XM for me to listen in my house...???  Total BS and greed - Goodbye XM!

After quickly installing and signing into my Sirius account I was able to play music. The music would shut off after 2 minutes and 30 seconds of playing. It would happen on any channel. I went onto the Sirius website to find some troubleshooting. It said if you have this problem to unplug your Echo for 30 seconds and plug it back in. Then let it sit untouched for 2 hours. The firmware will be updated and all should work. I unplugged my Echo and plugged it back in and let it sit over night. When I woke this morning, it worked!!!

I contacted Amazon support and the technician I chatted with acknowledged that they are aware of the issue and are working to get this resolved as soon as possible.  He also noted that the issue is rooted from a problem on the SiriusXM side, not Amazon (typical finger-pointing).

I also contacted the SiriusXM Corporate Solutions team.  They acknowledged they while they had no information on this issue in their KB, the issue was escalated to their engineering team for further review.  I have a case number logged and they will be getting back to me with any updates.
In both cases, I directly linked them to the reviews on this page to support that this is (obviously) a wide-spread issue.  Hopefully we'll get an answer or ETA to resolution soon!

I can listen to maybe 2, 3, or 4 songs on a station before it comes on and says another device is being used to stream, but that's not the case. When I contacted support, they said disconnect and reconnect the skill (21st century version of "did you turn it off then on again?" LOL). But that is not fixing the problem. When it happens, it's always at the end of a song, and if I ask Alexa to start the station again, it's always the same song that last played that starts. It's def a "First World Problem" and not much more than an annoyance, but, hey, it's 2019, everyone gets to gripe! Now, where's my award???

I've been using this app for many months now without any problems, but recently Alexa began telling me that SiriusXM was "not enabled" even though it certainly was.  After many futile attempts to re-enable it, I realized that the app wouldn't play SiriusXM on one Alexa device if it had already been playing SiriusXM on a second device but paused.  The command "stop" (which I had been using) pauses the play but does not exit the app.  Since Sirius only allows streaming on one device at a time, this "pause" was apparently interpreted as Sirius already playing on another device.  The commands "cancel" or "quit" (or asking for weather or time) on the second Alexa device properly exits the SiriusXM app, clearing the way for the intended device to respond properly.  If this "stop" (= pause) vs. "cancel" (= exit) command issue is the simple explanation for the many customer reports of the app being "not enabled" when it already is, SiriusXM should consider making this command difference clear, up-front, on the main web page.

All I get is a picture of the station i'm listening to and the name of the station.  That's it. review_description: Sirius Xm on Alexa devices NEEDS a subscription from SiriusXM for Streaming!. Yes, you must have Sirius XM STREAMING!  All Access has Streaming included and you may add Streaming  option to any subscription for an additional fee.  Mine worked since day one.  Many people seem to be having trouble.  At present, only 1 in 3 work and it may STOP working in the future for unknown reasons.  I have found that ALL of the Amazon Alexa appliances have a "memory" problem.  Depending on your device, it "fills up".  No rhyme nor reason for this, it just happens.  Rebooting sometimes works, but many times, you have to sign out and sign in again after rebooting.  The time of the memory "fill up" varies depending on how often you change channels, or listen to the Sirius XM feature.  It's great when it works.
Many have asked "how to shut down Alexa at night or anytime, for that matter, automatically without any alarms so it will "stop" whatever it's playing, by itself.  Here is the exact words to use:
Sleep Timers
By now you’ve probably heard about the new sleep timers feature, but just in case you missed Amazon’s email about it, here’s the scoop.
You can start any playlist (Prime or not), artist, genre, album, podcast or even audiobook you like, then once it’s begun to play say the wake word followed by:
“Set a sleep timer for [number] minutes.”
When time’s up, Alexa will turn off whatever was playing. There’s no alarm buzzer or beep that might rouse you again, either.

My advice is don't buy Sirius for Alexa because it simply doesn't work as advertised.

review_description: I read some of the reviews about “chasing the link process down the rabbit hole,” but I had no issues.
I looked up the SiriusXM Alexa Skill. I tapped SETTINGS.
I tapped LINK ACCOUNT
I logged into my SIRIUSXM ACCOUNT with my email and password for SIRIUSXM (not my Amazon/Alexa password).
Within 5 seconds I received the “linked” notification.
I said, “Alexa, play The Highway on SiriusXM,” and BAM! I’m listening to Stormee’s Hot 30 weekend countdown.
Easy breezy. Love it!

Simply a scam to increase revenue to a monopoly that should never have been allowed.

It took me a little while to figure out how to enable it - Alexa doesn't tell you that you haven't enabled it, she just says, "unable to find 'Hair Nation'" unless you enable the skill.  Once it was enabled, though, I had to go through a one-time pairing of my SiriusXM account, and it worked almost perfectly.  There are a handful of stations that Alexa can never seem to find (including, surprisingly, Hits 1!) unless I explicitly say "on SiriusXM", but I can say "Alexa, play Hair Nation"

or "Alexa, play Ozzy's Boneyard" and it comes right up.  I've never had the problem of having to re-pair my account like some others on here have suggested, so whatever was the problem there, it appears to have been fixed.

Jumped on this app as soon as I saw it was available. Just enable the skill, get a link to log into your account and just say "Alexa play (channel name) on SiriusXM" and your done! Every channel I've tried started playing, haven't had to repeat myself once and the quality is great.

Everything the Alexa app is supposed to do works perfectly for me, absolutely 0 issues using this app. I'm inclined to believe all the negative reviews are user error.

Like if you're not finding channels are you using the right name? Are you saying "on SiriusXM" at the end? Are you sure you're remembering your password correctly? If you're getting disconnected are you sure no one else is logged into your account?

I just find all the negative reviews hard to believe when it works buttery smooth for me. If you're a fan of SiriusXM you should give this app a chance. If something isn't working double check you're doing it right before just blaming the app. I've thought I was entering the right password before and I wasn't, thought I was saying the right thing before and I wasn't.

I really wanted to be in the category of the former but after I signed in and was Enabled, I asked for a song from my favorite channel, The Spectrum, and there it was, fantastic! Then I asked Alexa to play Classic Rewind, and she said, "Sorry, I can't reach Sirius XM right now." Why? What is the bug that keeps some of us frustrated? Before you say, "try disabling it and then re-enabling." Save your breath. I've read months of these wildly mixed reviews before trying it myself. Are we still the beta testers for Sirius and Amazon. Get your act together and give us an app that isn't a 50/50 proposition.

review_description: I can play "regular" SiriusXM channels all day long, but not the "Xtra 100" channels. (the ones that allow you to skip ahead songs and give you album art) For example, I can play the regular "1st Wave" channel all day long, but if I try to play "1st Wave Party", it stops after a few minutes and says something like "Streaming has stopped because the same account is being used on another device". I do not have any other devices on my account. I even changed my username & password just to be safe. I called Amazon Tech Support several times and they see nothing wrong. They won't even acknowledge the problem and tell me to contact Sirius, who tell me that "It's an Alexa device issue, so call them". Bottom line - if you want to listen to the "best" (in my opinion) Sirius channels, this skill does not work for those.

The SiriusXM skill on the Amazon Echo has some great benifets: 1: You have a variety of choices of music to listen to. You can practically listen to anything you want to on SiriusXM. I normally listen to "Prime Country" (channel 58) and "The Message. (channel 63) 2: It's not just in your car, it's also in your home! It's really easy to listen to SiriusXM anywhere, because of the Amazon Echo skill, and the mobile app, AND your car! 3: No commercials! You never have to listen to any annoying commercials on SiriusXM, which is the biggest reason I enjoy it.  Now, everything unfortunately has it's flaws, and the SiriusXM skill on the Amazon Echo is no exception. Here are some flaws I found in the skill: 1: It's pretty expensive. Right now, SiriusXM is offering a great deal for streaming on devices and SiriusXM in the car. It will cost you $8.33 a month for 12 months. Then, if you do not cancel your subscription at the end of this 12 month period, they will charge 20.99 a month for streaming plus car listening. It is definately a budget breaker. 2: The Echo doesn't have good satellite reception. Normally, it's a hit or miss scenario when your Echo is trying to connect to the SiriusXM satellite a couple miles in the air. Even when it does work, you will still experience interruptions occasionally. With your car, it's a different story. The satellite radio service will work even in your garage. 3: If you decide you don't want SiriusXM, you are bonded in a 12 month long contract. I'm warning you now: IF YOU SIGN UP FOR SIRIUSXM, YOU WILL BE BINDED TO A 12 MONTH LONG CONTRACT AND IF YOU CANCEL YOU WILL BE CHARGED A $50 CANCELLATION FEE, ACCORDING TO SIRIUSXM'S CUSTOMER AGREEMENT. Yes, you will be charged $50 if you decide you no longer want to pay for SiriusXM within your contract period. In general, I'd recommend getting just the car subscription, or just the streaming subscription. It's only $5 a month for 12 months. Of course, they raise the price to $15.99 after 12 months, but your contract with their company ends after 12 months. If you wish to continue to listen to SiriusXM, you will need to call them to renew your subscription. In general, it's a pretty good service.

* Please unplug your Echo device, plug it in again, let it boot up and then sit unused for two hours. After two hours, the device should have finished its firmware update. Please contact Amazon customer service at alexa.amazon.com if you continue to have issues.*

Alexa played the SiriusXM stream for me fine for about 15 to 20 minutes. Then silence. I asked Alexa to change to a different channel. Silence. I checked it on my handy-dandy iPhone SiriusXM app and it streamed just fine. Note: during this first failure, Alexa couldn't seem to play *any* music of any kind. Power Cycled Alexa. No SiriusXM heard, only Alexa saying "I'm sorry I can't play that music right now" after trying for about 15 seconds. Power Cycled Alexa again. Nothing. Rinse and repeat. Nothing. Unloaded the skill. Reloaded the skill. Nothing. Asked Alexa to play some other kind of music. She did. I screamed at Alexa. She screamed back. I kept screaming. She began to cry. "Oh yeah, turn the waterworks on... that's how you always end an argument." After awhile, I asked her to tell me the weather and Alexa did. I think I still like her even though she doesn't seem to want to play my SiriusXM stream.

To others having issues: I tried and tried to link Alexa and Sirius via my smartphone but it never worked. When I logged onto my Amazon Prime account via my lap top, then tried to link them, I had no problems whatsoever.  So, if you're having problems, try linking from your PC or lap top rather than your phone.

Another person wrote that they were unable to get the app to work.  I just set mine up and was surprised to find out that on the SiriusXM website, I needed to go into my account profile.  There I found out that there is a SEPARATE user ID and password that is associated with Internet access, which is how the SiriusXM app for Alexa is able to connect.

So I changed the user ID from the jibberish that it was to something else.  Be aware that you will probably not be able to use your e-mail address as this second user ID since it can only be 20 characters long.  Then you have to set the password as well.  Save your changes and put the new information into you password saving encryption software (if you are using something like this).

Once that was done, I went back to the Alexa app, started the SiriusXM app and entered the account information that I just create.  Just like that, it was ready to go.  I found out that I need to say, "Alexa, play SiriusXM."  Then she asks what I want to listen to.  Then I say whatever channel it is, such as "80's on 8."  I found that if I string it all together in one sentence, I found that it is not able to understand what I said.  The other thing that I found that works is saying, "Alexa, play Classic Rewind on SiriusXM."  For whatever reason, that works far more often.

Why not change it and all to be the same thing. Sometimes we are to say Alexa open and here you have to know to say Alexa play cnn on Sirius xm. Why not be able to say Akexa Open Sirius XM. Then Alexa would say what station would you like to hear or would you like a review? I love Alexas features but it is hard often to figure what you need to say to Alexa each time.

What good does creating a custom mix do if you can't play it within the skill?  Sure, if I listen from my computer or phone, I can play my custom mixed channels, but not in the skill.  It's a channel or a playlist just like all the rest, yet Alexa doesn't recognize it.  The custom mixes are on my account and Alexa links to it...so what gives?  And I also don't get why some streaming stations are allowed but others are not?  Why does SiriusXM charge more for streaming if I can't get all the stations?

Update:  Only 5 minutes after writing this review, the stream has cut off twice...Alexa says "Sorry, I'm having trouble playing the music".  Adjusting down to 2 stars.  This skill just doesn't work. If you are blind like I am, and you wanted to stream Sirius XM, but could not because your screen reader is not compatible with the internet player,This skill is just what you need. You can now hear all the channels on your tuner, and all the internet only channels including every team in major league baseball, the national basketball association, the national football league, and the national hockey league. Each team has it's own designated channel so you can listen to your home broadcast no matter where you are. Since I received an echo dot, I have loved everything about it, but this is the best skill yet! Happy listening.

For those of you unable to listen to SiriusXM on Alexa, it's not her fault.  Through trouble shooting I discovered it is on Sirius XM's end.  You need to do the following: reestablish a username and password for streaming sirius xm on the sirius xm app. Then go to Alexa app, go to Sirius XM icon in music, and disable skill, then re-enable skill with updated username and password.  Alexa now can play any sirius xm channel that you are subscribed to.  Works perfect!!!

To support those people unfortunately born with cognitive difficulties, the Sirius/XM Corporation hires these afflicted folks as their customer representatives and I.T. developers.  It’s a small inconvenience for their customer base, who obviously have little need to listen to their broadcasts in spite of paying a monthly fee.  Consider it a philanthropic contribution, although it is not tax deductible. While my Amazon Alexa account is linked to Sirius on Tuesday, it is no longer linked on Wednesday.  However, when I try to contact the Sirius Corporation, they have absolutely no record of my existence.  I have listened to Sirius since its inception, paid them on time, but according to them, I have never existed.  In fact, they tried to convince me I do not have Sirius in my car while I was listening to Sirius/XM radio. It was A Clockwork Orange moment. Sometimes my account mysteriously becomes linked again, so maybe I can listen to Sirius on Alexa by Thursday. Good luck if you want any help from Sirius.  Aid doesn’t exist.

As others have stated, when it works - it's awesome! I'm in the middle of an SXM internet trial to see how it worked and finding it hit & miss. First week, no issues, listened to it every morning, evening and sometimes in the afternoon if I was home. Past 4 days, Echo says it's playing but it's not. Then when it finally plays, it drops. It streams from my phone and computer, just not staying connected to Alexa/Echo. I'd subscribe to SXM if it worked most of the time, however, doesn't seem to be the case. I haven't experienced this issue with other trials so looks like I'll subscribe elsewhere when it comes time to decide. I don't have SXM in the car, so if I subscribe, it's 100% for home use via Alexa/Echos.

I still think this skill needs some tweaking and so, perhaps, does the SiriusXM side of the partnership.

Alexa stopped linking to my Sirius Xm account yesterday for no apparent reason. The app showed it was still linked. Found a fix for this...seems my user name for streaming Sirius was changed by Sirius. Try going to your Sirius account on line and go to the page for streaming (different log in info). My user name wasn't recognized, so I asked to retrieve my user name. Sirius sent an email with a completely different user name (random code but started with "OLD". Sign into the streaming feature using that ID (my password didn't change). Then copy that user name into the linking page in the Alexa app. Bang, Sirius linked to Alexa and I'm playing music again.

review_header: It's a good start, but definitely not complete
worked for a year and stopped 2 months ago

review_description: Unlike many others, I had absolutely no trouble connecting my account. I can now listen to my favorite channels using the Echo and that is worth 3 stars. That said there are some features available in the mobile/desktop app that are missing in this skill.
1) You can't find out what song is playing (currently it just gives the channel)
2) You can't pause and resume
3) You can't listen to on demand radio shows

One of the things I don't like about the Echo is its lack of discoverability. Even if these features are added there is no way to find out unless an email is sent out. However, if they are added I would gladly go back and update this to a higher rating.

Then, SIRIUS offered me a FREE Echo Dot, for adding a second subscription. I've only had the Dot for 2 days, but I absolutely love it! I can listen to all of my SIRIUS stations, PLUS my Amazon Prime music. And this little thing sounds like a stereo! But, it does so much more. I can ask about the weather, the time, play games, get jokes and words if the day. I can ask any question, pretty much like Google, and get an answer. It can be connected to a smart t.v. as well. So far, I'm very pleased with this little marvel!

When you first ask Alexa to call up SiriusXM, the service plays up to three minutes of commercials before you can hear any programming. That's already an insult, considering that you're already paying for SiriusXM. Then, sometimes you get more commercials if you change channels. If you don't have the service playing everywhere and move from one room (device) to another, you get to listen to yet more commercials when you start the skill in the next room.

And finally, the most irritating offense: SiriusXM periodically interrupts programming to play additional commercials. I don't mean you get commercials at the regular commercial breaks. I mean that you might be listening to an interview on CNN or Fox News, and suddenly the service will cut to commercials in the middle of someone speaking so that you don't hear the rest of the interview. When the feed resumes, you also get to enjoy all the regular commercial breaks in addition to these bonus commercials.

So overall, use this skill if you like listening to a ridiculous number of commercials, on a service you already pay for. Or you can always just go listen in your car for scratchy and dropped reception every time you pass a T-Mobile tower.

$17 a month, for each car. Shady, deceptive billing practices - god forbid you give them your credit card number, you'll be billed literally forever, whether or not you're using the service. And the "great" $8/mo rate that you got to start? it disappears without warning and those $17 per vehicle per month charges start adding up. Add to that telemarketer calls all day every day - I've got them blocked, and I still notice Sirius telemarketers calling twice a day - I haven't been a customer for 10 years!

Compared to, for example, Spotify - for $10/mo you can download playlists you like for offline listening, you can select exactly what you want to hear, and for an extra $5/mo everyone in your family has their own premium account. Or Pandora for $5/month; no credit card shenanigans. Or how about any of the dozens of free commercial-supported apps like Accuradio and iHeart Radio? Or the thousands of radio stations that stream online for nothing?
It's time for Sirius to turn out the lights, close and lock the doors, and call it a day. I only wish I could uninstall the Sirius app on my car radios.

Just set up Sirius on Alexa - you first need to enable the Sirius skill via the Alexa app. It'll prompt you for your Sirius username and password, once that's all set on the app you'll get a message confirming the Sirius skill is now enabled. After that's done you should be all set!  Just ask Alexa to play your favorite station...for example I said "Alexa play the Spectrum on SiriusXM" and it worked just fine. Make sure to use your streaming/internet login, which may be different from your billing login. Also, you may need to first go to Sirius' website and sign up for internet streaming if you haven't used it yet.  Even with an all access Sirius account, you still might need to enable internet streaming via their website if you haven't used their app yet. Good luck - it's great!!
